segment.source: Example 1: Migrating an Unsupported Application
segment.target: Example 1: Migrating an Unsupported Application

segment.source: The following is a template for the sections that you need to migrate your application.
segment.target: The following is a template for the sections that you need to migrate your application.

segment.source: The template is not functional on its own, but you can use it to write your own .xml file.
segment.target: The template is not functional on its own, but you can use it to write your own .xml file.

segment.source: Example 2: Migrating the My Videos Folder
segment.target: Example 2: Migrating the My Videos Folder

segment.source: The following is a custom .xml file named CustomFile.xml that migrates My Videos for all users, if the folder exists on the source computer.
segment.target: The following is a custom .xml file named CustomFile.xml that migrates My Videos for all users, if the folder exists on the source computer.

segment.source: Code
segment.target: Code

segment.source: Behavior
segment.target: Behavior

segment.source: Verifies that My Videos exists on the source computer.
segment.target: Verifies that My Videos exists on the source computer.

segment.source: Filters out the shortcuts in My Videos that do not resolve on the destination computer.
segment.target: Filters out the shortcuts in My Videos that do not resolve on the destination computer.

segment.source: This has no effect on files that are not shortcuts.
segment.target: This has no effect on files that are not shortcuts.

segment.source: For example, if there is a shortcut in My Videos on the source computer that points to C:\Folder1, that shortcut will be migrated only if C:\Folder1 exists on the destination computer.
segment.target: For example, if there is a shortcut in My Videos on the source computer that points to C:\Folder1, that shortcut will be migrated only if C:\Folder1 exists on the destination computer.

segment.source: However, all other files, such as .mp3 files, migrate without any filtering.
segment.target: However, all other files, such as .mp3 files, migrate without any filtering.

segment.source: Migrates My Videos for all users.
segment.target: Migrates My Videos for all users.

segment.source: Example 3: Migrating Files and Registry Keys
segment.target: Example 3: Migrating Files and Registry Keys

segment.source: This table describes the behavior in the following example .xml file.
segment.target: This table describes the behavior in the following example .xml file.

segment.source: Code
segment.target: Code

segment.source: Behavior
segment.target: Behavior

segment.source: Migrates all instances of the file Usmttestfile.txt from all sub-directories under %ProgramFiles%\USMTTestFolder.
segment.target: Migrates all instances of the file Usmttestfile.txt from all sub-directories under %ProgramFiles%\USMTTestFolder.

segment.source: Migrates the whole directory under %ProgramFiles%\USMTDIRTestFolder.
segment.target: Migrates the whole directory under %ProgramFiles%\USMTDIRTestFolder.

segment.source: Migrates all instances of MyKey under HKCU\Software\USMTTESTKEY.
segment.target: Migrates all instances of MyKey under HKCU\Software\USMTTESTKEY.

segment.source: Migrates the entire registry hive under HKLM\Software\USMTTESTKEY.
segment.target: Migrates the entire registry hive under HKLM\Software\USMTTESTKEY.

segment.source: Example 4: Migrating Specific Folders from Various Locations
segment.target: Example 4: Migrating Specific Folders from Various Locations

segment.source: The behavior for this custom .xml file is described within the tags in the code.
segment.target: The behavior for this custom .xml file is described within the tags in the code.
